name: elmer t beanie
notes:
a simple hat with fun details created to celebrate our tweed merino and cashmere blend! the knitting is fun with a half ribbing pattern to start, but the magic of this piece is in the blocking – the cashmere bloom, the unbelievably soft and light fabric that results – we dare you to stop at just one hat!

sample shown
dimond laine elmer tweed worsted in color thermal.

sizes
one size. to fit an average adult head.

finished measurements
approx. 18" circuference and 9" tall.

yarn requirements
*please note these are yarn estimates. the amount used will depend on yarn, your personal gauge, and any modifications you make.*

dimond laine elmer tweed worsted (70% merino, 30% cashmere; 135 yards per 50 grams); 1 skein.

or

worsted-weight in the following amount:
135 yards / 123 m.

needles
*needles listed are suggested.*

gauge needle: us 6 (4mm) 16" circular and double point needles.

ribbing needle: us 4 (3.5mm) 16" circular needle.

tools
darning needle; 2 markers (1 unique to mark beginning of round).

gauge
20 stitches and 28 rounds = 4" in stockinette stitch in the round on gauge needle.
